title: Entering the Glass Cockpit: TBM 930 & Garmin G3000 Guide
description:
Master the TBM 930 in Microsoft Flight Simulator (MSFS) as we begin Entering the Glass Cockpit! This TBM 930 tutorial covers the Garmin G3000, startup basics, and cockpit systems for beginners. Welcome to Part 2 of our series! We‚Äôre diving deep into this high-performance turboprop to show you exactly how to find the right documentation and prep the aircraft for power.

In this episode, we break down the essentials: finding the right documentation, prepping the aircraft for power, and a full guided tour of the cockpit using pro camera shortcuts. We‚Äôre also getting hands-on with the Garmin G3000, GTC-580 controllers, and PFD/MFD settings to get you flight-ready.

Stay tuned until the end for a "nice-to-know" G3000 pro tip!.

üìñ Chapters
In this video, we cover:

00:00 - Entering the TBM 930 Glass Cockpit
00:32 - Series Intro & Overview
00:54 - TBM 930 Startup: Getting Ready
02:41 - Inside Tour of the TBM 930 Cockpit
05:41 - TBM 930 Garmin G3000 "Wake Up"
08:26 - Garmin G3000 PFD Deep Dive
15:03 - Garmin G3000 MFD Features
20:31 - TBM 930 Flight Planning (MFD)
33:37 - Weight, Fuel & Performance Settings
42:33 - TBM 930 Nice-to-Know Fact
42:58 - Recap & Outro

üì∑Quick camera views

- shift 1: primary flight display (PFD)
- shift 2: multi function display (MFD)
- shift 3: autopilot controls
- shift 4: overview of PFD, MFD, autopilot controls, A/C, de ice system, landing gear,  pressurization and hot air flow
- shift 5: throttle, trim, flap controls and fuel selector
- shift 6: external/internal lights, electric power, engine start, fuel, ap/trims, ELT and oxygen controls
- shift 7: similar like the previous option but including the panel emer
- shift 8: power plugs
- shift 9: left door
- shift 0: passenger door
